intro: Josemania asplundii, commonly known as the red-flowered josemania, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in dense clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant features lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for warm climates. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
